page.title: 19BURGHFIELD-A TYPICAL SUNDAY
page.content: Matthew is a pupil at Garland Junior School.Here,he descibes a typical Sunday. "After breakfast,we usually go down to the woods and jump off a tree that is broken at the base.I used to jump off the second highest branch,but now I jump off the highest.Then we go to the stream and make boats from pieces of wood.Afterwards,I get my football and we play "Three and In",that is, when someone has scored three goals, he becomes the goalkeeper. "Dinner is usually roast pork,lamb, beef or chicken with cauliflower,peas, potatoes and carrots,followed by peaches and cream. "After dinner,we go to the cornfields walking in the tracks.Then we go to the ford or the old Anderson bomb shelter.After tea,we play in the park until it is time to have a bath."
